title: Aesc
content:
**[Indices](http://web.archive.org/web/20141002102307/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Indices) : [Characters](http://web.archive.org/web/20141002102307/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Characters)/ [Terminology](http://web.archive.org/web/20141002102307/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Terminology) : Aesc**

The aesc (pronounced "ash") is a [ligature](http://web.archive.org/web/20141002102307/http:/typophile.com/wiki/ligature) of the letters a and e. Archaic in English it is representative of a dipthong vowel sound in certain languages.

**Typophile Threads:**  
 [Swashy AE & OE](http://web.archive.org/web/20141002102307/http:/typophile.com/node/10605)  
 [AE preference](http://web.archive.org/web/20141002102307/http:/typophile.com/node/68140)  
 [æ](http://web.archive.org/web/20141002102307/http:/typophile.com/node/68510)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20141002102307im_/http:/typophile.com/files/aesc.gif)

See also: [Ethel](http://web.archive.org/web/20141002102307/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Ethel)
author: paul d hunt
